intro: Sclarea virgata, commonly known as the slender angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and compound leaves.
